location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter from Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government of Bombay to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, on the predatory assaults of Joasimese [Qasimi] pirates, in violation of their assurances to the British government.In enclosure, letter from C W Elwood, Agent to Government at Poorbunder to Francis Warden,dated 11 November 1813, informing that a Poorbunder [Porbandar, India] merchant boat sailing to Muscat fell in with a Joasimese Pirate on 1 November on the Coast of Muscat, and the pirate escaped throwing overboard the greater part of the cargo.
